title: History of the Israel national football team
text:
<a href="Israel%20national%20football%20team">Israel's men's national football team</a> has represented <a href="Israel">Israel</a> in international <a href="association%20football">football</a> contests since 1930. The team is overseen by the <a href="Israel%20Football%20Association">Israel Football Association</a>, the administrative body of <a href="Israeli%20football">Israeli football</a>.
Since its inception, the Israeli team has played in 436 official games (as of November 2010). These games have resulted in 162 wins, 104 draws, and 170 losses. The teams last qualified for either the World Cup or European Championships was in 1970 when the World Cup was held in <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>. The team also won the <a href="AFC%20Asian%20Cup">AFC Asian Cup</a> held in Israel in 1964.
Israel is the only team who has played in more than two regional international competitions—<a href="Oceania">Oceania</a>, <a href="Asia">Asia</a> and <a href="Europe">Europe</a>. Although Israel belongs to Asia, political tension related to the <a href="Arab%E2%80%93Israeli%20conflict">Arab–Israeli conflict</a> has prevented Muslim and Arab teams from playing against each other. Since 1991, Israel has been part of the <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a>, the European soccer federation.
Pre-State.
In June 1928, <a href="Sir%20Alfred%20Mond">Sir Alfred Mond</a>, visited Mandate Palestine. Mond was an amateur footballer, and during his visit, he announced his willingness to fund the establishment of a national squad of 18 players who would travel to games in England, in order to play in the first league. While there had previously been a number of local teams fielded in exhibition games abroad, Mond was the first to propose establishment of a national team. He met with the heads of "Maccabi" and "HaPoel", the dominant local sports organizations. Despite the hostilities that existed then between the organizations, it was decided to implement the proposal of Richmond to establish three committees would be responsible for organizing a team.
A tournament was played between the major football clubs at the time: <a href="Hapoel%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Hapoel Tel Aviv</a>, <a href="Maccabi%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Maccabi Tel Aviv</a>, <a href="Hapoel%20Haifa%20F.C.">Hapoel Haifa</a> and <a href="Maccabi%20Hashmonai%20Jerusalem">Maccabi Hashmonai Jerusalem</a>. While Hapoel Tel Aviv won the tournament without a single loss, the committee included players from the other teams in the national team. Discipline problems also arose within the group and the organizing committee feared serious discipline problems during the voyage to England. Local criticism and criticism between the two sports unions led to a request from Sir Mond to send a professional coach from England to train the club for competition in England in 1929.
Cairo 1931 games.
The Football Association in Israel / Palestine was established on 14 August 1928 and was accepted as a member of FIFA a year later in 1929. The Home Association (now the <a href="Israel%20Football%20Association">Israel Football Association</a>) wanted to send a national team to the first World Cup in Uruguay, but because of the boycott imposed by the Association English Football FIFA at the time the order was given by the British government did not allow the team to attend the World Cup.
In April 1930, the team played its first games. The squad traveled to <a href="Cairo">Cairo</a> for a series of games with Egypt. The delegation to Egypt included six Jews and Arabs - one from Nadi Riad al Arab. These players are considered the first Israeli team. The first game was held in Cairo on April 10 with a full stadium and the Egyptian team won 5–0.
First game in British Mandate.
The team's first game was held in <a href="Egypt">Egypt</a> in 1934 against the Egyptian national football team, which they lost 7:1. Since the founding of the team until the founding of the state the team held five games, all against rivals in the eastern Mediterranean.
21st century.
After Nielsen, coach <a href="Avram%20Grant">Avram Grant</a> was appointed to the team, which failed its first tournament but later managed to improve its image and return the selected game audience. During the 2006 World Cup qualifying, Israel finished unbeaten but failed to qualify to the playoffs because of inferiority in goal margins.
In 2006 appointed coach <a href="Dror%20Kashtan">Dror Kashtan</a>, who guided the national team in the Euro 2008 qualifying tournament presented a series of victories in the exterior of the groups that are rated below a home victory of <a href="Russia">Russia</a>n team score 1:2, but lost other games and finished the tournament in fourth place, with the same number of points as <a href="England">England</a>. Following the campaign, was Israel's first-ever second rate in Europe and later increased its peak position in the world to 15th place. At the end of the early tournament was decided that Kashtan will continue to guide the national team World Cup 2010 qualifying too. Due to the rise of Israel to rank second quality in Europe, it won the lottery, and this tournament, when the main rivals were supposed to be <a href="Greece">Greece</a> and <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>, along with teams that were considered eclecticism weaker—<a href="Moldova">Moldova</a>, <a href="Latvia">Latvia</a> and <a href="Luxembourg">Luxembourg</a>. However, the result was a culmination in a home loss in team Latvia, destroyed the chances of Israel's first right house.
Balance achievements and failures.
One of the games in the history of official Israeli Israeli soccer team was on 13 October 1993, when Israel's national team played against <a href="France">France</a> national park de France stadium in France in 1994 World Cup qualifier, when France's victory was credited with participation in the World Cup. After the home game against the French team lost to Israel 4–0; Israel won 3–2, and following the loss, France lost the World Cup in favor of immigration that came, and <a href="Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a> finished the tournament in fourth place.
Other big games are 2:1 victory over <a href="Yugoslavia">Yugoslavia</a> in <a href="Belgrade">Belgrade</a>, <a href="Rome">Rome</a> Olympics qualifier (1960) (Yugoslavia Israel ahead so the only margin goals, and won the Olympic silver medal) and victory in October 1981 <a href="Portugal">Portugal</a> 4–1 World Cup qualifier in 1982, with the striker's hat-trick of tobacco. In recent years, ballet team victory 5–0 on the Ramat Gan Stadium in <a href="Austria">Austria</a> in 1999. That Israel's national team qualified for tournament games intersection, but was knocked out by Denmark.
On the great victories, were also selected multiple failures. For the 1958 World Cup team was close to <a href="illegal%20immigration">illegal immigration</a> World Cup qualifying tournament after <a href="Turkey">Turkey</a> refused to <a href="Indonesia">Indonesia</a> national team play against the Israeli team. FIFA has decided that Israel will have to deal a decisive games against <a href="Wales">Wales</a>, which lost twice 0:2.
Until the eighties was completely identical, or nearly complete, the Olympic team and national team. Burner failure was not the team's Ahaplatah <a href="1964%20Summer%20Olympics">Tokyo Olympics</a> in 1964, following the home loss to <a href="South%20Vietnam">South Vietnam</a>. Four years later came to Israel for the first time the Olympic football tournament, when the team easily won the Ceylon (now <a href="Sri%20Lanka">Sri Lanka</a>) 7:0 and 4:0 qualified for the Olympics in Mexico (1968). Increased team qualified to the quarter-finals when the Olympic tournament, was eliminated only after a lottery after a 1:1 draw with Bulgaria.
After the 1970 World Cup illegal immigration is a failed attempt to qualify for the house twice early Asia. Israel qualified for the Olympics in between <a href="Montreal">Montreal</a> (1976), and again reached the quarter-finals. 1986 World Cup qualifier is a failed attempt to climb out of the Oceania World Cup, after four years earlier in European Mshsubcah failed. 1990 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> qualifying, Israel has to go through the house and reached the Oceania playoff game against <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>, which lost 0–1 and finished in a draw zero out the Ramat Gan Stadium.
1993 to 2010 rating.
Since 1993, <a href="FIFA">FIFA</a> rankings are published monthly. The teams rating as of December 2010 is the world's 50th. The highest ranking the team has held was 15th place, in November 2008, under coach Dror Kashtan. The lowest ranking the team has held was 71st place, in September 1993, under the guidance of coach <a href="Shlomo%20Scharf">Shlomo Scharf</a>. On average, the team has placed between 25th and 35th.
